items.value: Press Exit once more to exit application.
You can receive informations on Twitter @Tempest_Wave.
Send your inquirements to Twitter @Tempest_Wave or e-mail tpstwave@gmail.com if you have one.
Tempest Wave prepares a new leap with 2.0. Lots of things have been changed, so please read the instruction.
Adding songs has become more convenient with Simple adding.
Tempest Wave supports two platforms, Windows PC and Android.
Every text of Tempest Wave is rich text.
Tempest Wave currently supports WAV and Ogg Vorbis music file. In Android version MP3 file is also supported.
TWx is the new unified beatmap format of Tempest Wave.
Tempest Wave Creator will arrive at here. Please stay tuned!.
Tempest Wave currently offers 5L STARLIGHT and 2L/4L/6L THEATER game mode.
To load external BGA in Android, your Android OS version should be equal to or higher than 5.0.
You can designate start frame of BGA by using the header '#bgastart' in info.txt.
Buffering can be occured in BGA playing, depending on your storage's speed.
You can set flick severity in three levels.
If you activate Dynamic flick judging, flick severity will be adjusted dynamically between Loose and Strict.
Canvas note mode dyes notes with various colors in the beatmap.
TWx is the most powerful, free-to-include and free-to-use beatmap format.
The meaning of 'x' in TWx is almost as same as the meaning of 'x' in mathematics.

If you are using info.txt, please check the format declaration.
Press 'Yes' button to reload the list.
Click the button and press keyboard key.
The higher the value is, the earlier the appear time of notes becomes.
If it is activated, flick severity will be adjusted by the distance between notes.
Resolutions above 720p will be adjusted to 720p.

Tempest Wave Creator is a beatmap editor which is provided with Tempest Wave. Now you can create your own beatmap using the power of the TWx. Things written below are the usage of the Tempest Wave Creator.

<color=yellow>Controls</color>
Left mouse click or touch on the block : Add note
Left mouse click or long touch on the note : Delete note
Right mouse click or short touch on the note : Select/deselect note
Keyboard controls
- 1, 2, 3, 4, ... : Set the start point value
- ` : Set the start point value as auto
- Q, W, E, R, T : Set the type of the note (Normal, Long, Slide, Damage, Hidden)
- A, S, D, F, G : Set the flick direction (None, Left, Right, Up, Down)

<color=yellow>Editing</color>
- To add notes you should add a block. Set your preferred BPM value and press 'Add a block' button to add a block.
- Set the start point, size, speed and other values and click or touch the block to add a note.
- While adding long, slide and flick note, you should place them all at once. Press 'Finish and cancel' button to cancel placing.
- Press 'Specific view' button to see the specific information of notes. Color, start point and speed of the note will be displayed.
- You can select blocks using checkboxes and change selected blocks' BPM, color and speed value.
- If you change BPM, speed, color value after selecting notes, changed value will be reflected immediately.
- After selecting notes, you can adjust start and end point finely in the 'Point adjuster'.

<color=yellow>Metadata</color>
- Press the top-left 'Open metadata' button to see the metadata.
- Metadata includes the name of the song, the artist, the mapper, the line count, the difficulty, the density(level) and the offset.
- You can add a block only after selecting line count. Changing line count deletes all blocks existing.
- You should input the name of the song. You can leave the artist and the mapper empty.
- Offset determines the start time of the music. You can select and play music files to check the offset.
- Put your music files into the Creator folder to select music files.

<color=yellow>Saving and loading</color>
You can save the beatmap by pressing 'Save' button. Also, you can load TWx files created by Tempest Wave Creator. When you press 'Exit' button, the unsaved progress will be deleted.
Choose the place to place next long note.
Choose the place to place next slide note.
Choose the place to place next flick note.

Tempest Wave ?, now running on #

Tempest Wave is a second-creation tool which imitates the mechanism of some series of rhythm games. Tempest Wave do not provide any playable songs in and of itself, so users should add their own songs and beatmaps. Tempest Wave has the potential to be discontinued at any time by outside pressure. Developer do not take any financial gain while developing and distributing Tempest Wave.

Thank you for using Tempest Wave!
by NoMansLand (a.k.a thiEFcat)
